COMM   Four Vietnamese witnesses guided the Team to an aircraft crash site probably correlating to priority Case 1719 and pointed out the location where two Americans were buried. The team found no evidence of remains or personal effects.

RSCHR  jego
COMM   REF reported information from an article in the 7 June 1968 issue of the Vietnamese newspapers, "Quang Binh". The article described the capture of one POW who parachuted into the sea and was caputured on land and a second POW who parachuted into the sea and was captured in the same village on 18 May 1968. Cites IIR 6024027103 unresolved case 1181 U.S. pilot captured in May 1968 in Quang Binh Province, VM.

FOLD   118-2
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Yen Bai
KYWDS  Crash site
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   NOK to be notified that the pieces of wreckage found at a crash site in Yen Bai Province belong to an F-105 not an F-111 and that the Joint Field Activity (JFA) has requested the Vietnamese government locate for interview, the former commander of a company that allegedly shot down an F-111 on 28 Sep 72.

REELC  0

RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Lao villagers in Khammouan Province claim no knowledge of source of aircraft wreckage in village or of any grave sites. Aerial photographs indicate crash site on Phou Louang Mountain. Future investigation in a dry season recommended.

SUBJ   Family conference.
CAT    Casualty Files
PAGE   99-101
REEL   519
REELC  0
FOLD   118-12
CNTRY  Laos
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. Aircraft crashed into Phou Louang Mountain in Khammouan Province on 11 Jan 1968. Crash site was located by aerial photographs on 25 Jan 1968. Aircraft wreckage, personal effects, dog tags, probable human remains were recovered from crash site in April 1996. More personal effects and remains were recovered in March 2001 and March 2002. Remains were identified by CILHI 11 Oct 2002.

Aircraft wreckage, personal effects, dog tags, probable human remains were recovered from crash site in April 1996. More personal effects and remains were recovered in March 2001 and March 2002. Remains were identified by CILHI 11 Oct 2002.

KYWDS  Quang Nam-Danang
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Letter to American Embassy from Vietnamese source requests information on remains he claims he turned over to the Public Security Agency in Quang Nam Province in November 1987 (though his receipt is dated January 1987). The remains were identified as Walton's and repatriated in October 1992.

SUBJ   Family conference
CAT    Casualty Files
PAGE   114-116
REEL   518
REELC  0
FOLD   118-9
CNTRY  Laos
KYWDS  Khammouan
KYWDS  Crash site
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. Aircraft crashed into Phou Louang Mountain in Khammouan Province on 11 Jan 1968. Crash site was located by aerial photographs on 25 Jan 1968. Aircraft wreckage, personal effects, dog tags, probable human remains were recovered from crash site in April 1996. More personal effects and remains were recovered in March 2001 and March 2002. Remains were identified by CILHI 11 Oct 2002.
SUBJ   Family conference
CAT    Casualty Files
PAGE   114-116
REEL   518
REELC  0
FOLD   118-9
CNTRY  Laos
KYWDS  Khammouan
KYWDS  Crash site
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. Aircraft crashed into Phou Louang Mountain in Khammouan Province on 11 Jan 1968. Crash site was located by aerial photographs on 25 Jan 1968. Aircraft wreckage, personal effects, dog tags, probable human remains were recovered from crash site in April 1996. More personal effects and remains were recovered in March 2001 and March 2002. Remains were identified by CILHI 11 Oct 2002.

TYPE   Miscellaneous
DOR    98 08 05
DOI    00 00 00
ORG    JTF-FA
SUBJ   Biographic/site report as of 05 August 1998
CAT    Casualty Files
PAGE   101-105
REEL   517
REELC  0
FOLD   118-1
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations from loss of radio and radar contact in Quang Binh Province on 10 Oct 1972 to date. From Sep 1989 through Aug 1997, numerous sources claimed to hold remains or to have heard of someone who did, but none of them produced any evidence other than information from Cleary's dog tags. In Mar 1998, an investigation team received possible remains in Thanh Hoa Province
SUBJ   Biographic/site report as of 05 August 1998
CAT    Casualty Files
PAGE   101-105
REEL   517
REELC  0
FOLD   118-1
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations from loss of radio and radar contact in Quang Binh Province on 10 Oct 1972 to date. From Sep 1989 through Aug 1997, numerous sources claimed to hold remains or to have heard of someone who did, but none of them produced any evidence other than information from Cleary's dog tags. In Mar 1998, an investigation team received possible remains in Thanh Hoa Province

RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Unidentified North Vietnamese unit claims they captured pilot on 10 Oct 72 in the area of Ha Dong, Ha Tay Province. An F-4 aircraft was down, probably due to fuel exhaustion, on the same day in Quang Binh Province.

KYWDS  Crash site
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. Last radio and radar contact with aircraft was 10 Oct 1972 over Quang Binh Province. Subject of numerous bogus dog tag reports since Jan 1987. Dental and bone fragments recovered from a crash site in Quang Binh Province in May and Aug 1994, previously thought to be associated with another case, and additional remains found at the same site by a Vietnamese witness in 1975 and repatriated in June 1998, were identified as Cleary's by CILHI.

--REC--3172
IU     03/07/2005
NAME   Poole, Charlie S.
REFNO  1954-0-02
SERV   USAF
TYPE   Miscellaneous
DOR    97 07 09
DOI    97 07 09
ORG    JTF-FA
SUBJ   Biographic/site report as of 9 July 1997
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   248-254
REEL   520
REELC  0
FOLD   119-5
CNTRY  North Vietnam, pre-1975
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Killed
KYWDS  Remains
KYWDS  Personal effects
KYWDS  Crash site
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes the results of investigations to date. Shot down by SAM missile on 19 Dec 1972 in Ha Tay Province. Four of six crewmen bailed out, were captured, and were later released during Operation Homecoming in March 1973. Two of the six crewmen were unaccounted for. In January and February 1996, personal effects and possible human remains were recovered at a crash site associated with this case. Aircraft wreckage recovered at the crash site positively identified the B-52 involved in this case. Status as of 8 June 1979 is KIA, body not recovered
EDIT   06/09/2005
SUBJ   Biographic/site report as of 9 July 1997
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   248-254
REEL   520
REELC  0
FOLD   119-5
CNTRY  North Vietnam, pre-1975
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Killed
KYWDS  Remains
KYWDS  Personal effects
KYWDS  Crash site
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes the results of investigations to date. Shot down by SAM missile on 19 Dec 1972 in Ha Tay Province. Four of six crewmen bailed out, were captured, and were later released during Operation Homecoming in March 1973. Two of the six crewmen were unaccounted for. In January and February 1996, personal effects and possible human remains were recovered at a crash site associated with this case. Aircraft wreckage recovered at the crash site positively identified the B-52 involved in this case. Status as of 8 June 1979 is KIA, body not recovered

NAME   Poole, Charlie S.
REFNO  1954-0-02
SERV   USAF
TYPE   Miscellaneous
DOR    04 04 07
DOI    04 04 07
ORG    DPMO
SUBJ   Family conference
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   265-267
REEL   520
REELC  0
FOLD   119-5
CNTRY  North Vietnam, pre-1975
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Crash site
KYWDS  Remains
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. B-52 shot down by surface-to-air missile over Ha Tay Province on 19 Dec 1972. Four of six crewmen bailed out, were captured, and later released during Operation Homecoming. Two were unaccounted for. Possible human remains recovered from a crash site subsequently identified with the aircraft of this case were repatriated on 5 Mar 1996. AFIRB (Armed Forces Identification Review Board) identified the remains on 12 Aug 2003

COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. B-52 shot down by surface-to-air missile over Ha Tay Province on 19 Dec 1972. Four of six crewmen bailed out, were captured, and later released during Operation Homecoming. Two were unaccounted for. Possible human remains recovered from a crash site subsequently identified with the aircraft of this case were repatriated on 5 Mar 1996. IU     03/23/2005
NAME   Forrester, Ronald W.
REFNO  1973-0-02
SERV   USMC
TYPE   Miscellaneous
DOR    04 04 08
DOI    72 12 27
ORG    DPMO
SUBJ   Family conference
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   202-208
REEL   520
REELC  0
FOLD   119-3
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Quang Binh
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes the results of investigations to date. A-6 aircraft downed in Quang Binh Province on 27 Dec 1972. Remains were reported buried, exhumed, reburied, exhumed again and have been lost. Neither definitive material evidence nor remains have been found at alleged crash site permanently under water in irrigation canal as of Feb 2004. Further excavation is planned.
SUBJ   Family conference
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   202-208
REEL   520
REELC  0
FOLD   119-3
CNTRY  post-1975 Vietnam
KYWDS  Quang Binh
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes the results of investigations to date. A-6 aircraft downed in Quang Binh Province on 27 Dec 1972. Remains were reported buried, exhumed, reburied, exhumed again and have been lost. Neither definitive material evidence nor remains have been found at alleged crash site permanently under water in irrigation canal as of Feb 2004. Further excavation is planned.
--REC--3400

--REC--4062
IU     08/08/2005
NAME   Trembley, J. Forrest G.
NAME   Scott, Dain V.
REFNO  0800-0-01
REFNO  0800-0-02
SERV   USN
TYPE   Message
DOR    94 01 14
DOI    93 12 13
IIRN   140912ZJAN94
ORG    CDR JTF-FA Honolulu
SUBJ   Detailed report of investigation: Case 0800
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   34-47
REEL   525
REELC  0
FOLD   122-15
CNTRY  China
KYWDS  Grave site
KYWDS  Remains
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Statements by Chinese former militiamen on finding the bodies of two pilots after they had ejected from their downed aircraft on 21 Aug 67, photographs of the bodies taken at the time, and burial in separate locations, correlate to this case. The remains were washed away in subsequent floods and the grave sites can no longer be located. The investigation team recommends that no further attempt be made to search or excavate these sites and the remains be declared non-recoverable
EDIT   09/13/2005
SUBJ   Detailed report of investigation: Case 0800
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   34-47
REEL   525
REELC  0
FOLD   122-15
CNTRY  China
KYWDS  Grave site
KYWDS  Remains
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Statements by Chinese former militiamen on finding the bodies of two pilots after they had ejected from their downed aircraft on 21 Aug 67, photographs of the bodies taken at the time, and burial in separate locations, correlate to this case. The remains were washed away in subsequent floods and the grave sites can no longer be located. The investigation team recommends that no further attempt be made to search or excavate these sites and the remains be declared non-recoverable
EDIT   09/13/2005

ORG    DPMO
SUBJ   Family conference
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   84-88
REEL   525
REELC  0
FOLD   122-15
CNTRY  China
KYWDS  Remains
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
KYWDS  Dog tag
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. In October 1999, a previously unknown witness turned over partial remains and an ID tag to a joint U.S.-PRC investigation team. He claimed that he had observed the original shoot down, that later in 1975 he had found remains in the general area and buried them, and in 1994 had retrieved some of the remains. On 24 Mar 2004, JPAC CIL identified the remains as those of Trembley
EDIT   09/13/2005
SUBJ   Family conference
CAT    Casualty files
PAGE   84-88
REEL   525
REELC  0
FOLD   122-15
CNTRY  China
KYWDS  Remains
KYWDS  Aircraft downed
KYWDS  Dog tag
RSCHR  cmin
COMM   Summarizes results of investigations to date. In October 1999, a previously unknown witness turned over partial remains and an ID tag to a joint U.S.-PRC investigation team. He claimed that he had observed the original shoot down, that later in 1975 he had found remains in the general area and buried them, and in 1994 had retrieved some of the remains. On 24 Mar 2004, JPAC CIL identified the remains as those of Trembley

COMM   Includes text of letter from Chinese official to Congressman Benjamin A. Gilman, claiming that Trembley and Scott were shot down and killed. They were buried in shallow graves but their remains have been washed away and can no longer be found

COMM   No evidence of aircraft wreckage found at any of three alleged crash sites in Thua Thien-Hue Province. Name on ID tag provided by a Vietnamese witness is not associated with any unaccounted-for individual.
